abstract: The Supreme Court will hear a case Tuesday that could affect the way banks cooperate with rivals and create syndicates to share the risks and rewards of initial public offerings. Eight of the nine justices will hear the oral argument in Glen Billing v. Credit Suisse First Boston, a class action that asks what role, if any, antitrust law should play in the regulation of the securities industry, and specifically in policing I.P.O.’s.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court will hear a case Tuesday that could affect the way banks cooperate with rivals and create syndicates to share the risks and rewards of initial public offerings. Eight of the nine justices will hear the oral argument in Glen Billing v. Credit Suisse First Boston, a class action that asks what role, if any, antitrust law should play in the regulation of the securities industry, and specifically in policing I.P.O.’s.

headline.main: I.P.O. Case Goes to Supreme Court
